dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We TRACK through the living room, passing framed photos o athletic eleven year old boy, and we hear a WOMAN'S VOICE she comes down the stairs with a GOLDEN RETRIEVER at her side.

dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes Donna, I'm out the door. We TRACK over the Woman's shoulder and follow her into th kitchen, unable to see her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just inform Kayleigh that anesthesia is on the way to prep the epidural and I'll be there as soon as I can. Still looking over her shoulder, we watch her absently straighten a PHOTOGRAPH of her son on the fridge as she talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And promise her she's about to have a woooonnderful labor. As the woman pours herself a fresh cup of coffee, her HOUSEKEEPER enters the kitchen with a full laundry basket They give each other a silent wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, I'll see you in twenty. She hangs up her cordless and takes a breath as we COME AROUND to finally REVEAL JESSICA MARTIN; slightly weary, ready for the day ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buenas dias, Rosario.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning Miss Jessica. Jessica sees her answering machine blinking, hits PLAY. In the background, a cheerful Rosario enters frame and he for the back door carrying the basket of laundry.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: (on machine) Honey? Honey, wake up.   Pick up the- And as she brings the coffee cup to her lips-- SLAMM!! The door EXPLODES open and a squad of FIVE GUNMEN storm in, wearing SKI-MASKS. Everything is a whirlwind of quick cuts, noise and confusion. Jessica's DOG starts to lunge at the men and -- thup! -- stilled by a silenced pistol before its second bark. Rosario runs for the ALARM SYSTEM --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from there! Don't touch that -- !! -- but as she reaches out for the PANIC BUTTON -- BLAM!! blows her away, too. The Gunman curses, then turns on Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUNMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (dire) Where is he? Jessica cringes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong answer. The bastard hauls back and -- WHAM I -- punches her in th face, knocking Jessica cold. Then he turns to his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Search the house. And as the answering machine fills the silence:

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG VO
dialogues.text: (on machine) -I'll call back later. The LEAD GUNMAN spins around, and we PUSH INTO the blackn of his masked face.

dialogues.text: The BLACKNESS of a BLACK VAN and ESCALADE passing below u We quickly CRANE DOWN to see the vehicles traveling throu An IRON GATE at the edge of an aband9ned property. They bounce down a long lonely driveway lined with barren tree ANGLE ON: THE KIDNAPPERS' VAN as it arrives at its destination; an isolated HOUSE in the Hills. The grass is dead. The trees are dead. It's the kind of place you coul scream for a week and no one would hear a thing. As the van stops--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door CRASHES open. Light slices through the dark reveal the dusty, skeletal interior. Jessica is hurled into the room and falls to the floor. With bound hands, she frantically pulls her blindfold off to see--

dialogues.speaker: THE LEAD SKI-MASKED KIDNAPPER
dialogues.text: Standing in front of her.    Sturdier than the rest.   So Imposing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wh... what do you want? Unsettlingly, the Kidnapper says nothing, staring at her. Jessica tries to remain calm under his angry gaze... Then suddenly, the Kidnapper turns and exits the room. Jessica breathes a sigh of relief...but it catches in her throat as he returns ten seconds later -- with a BASEBALL Grim as death, he stalks toward her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait.. And reaching.her, he hauls back and SWINGS --

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: SMASH! The bat connects with a wooden beam an inch above Jessica's head, OBLITERATING the ROTARY DIAL TELEPHONE th hung there. As phone guts shower down on her, the Lead Kidnapper turn and stomps away, slamming the attic door shut and locking Jessica in the darkness. Only now that they're gone does Jessica allow her fear to show through. Trembling, tears running down her face, Jessica finally breaks down, pleading to the empty attic-

dialogues.text: Wha... what the hell is happening?! The attic's suffocating silence is the only answer she ge

dialogues.text: Skimming along the water. And we TILT UP to reveal the majestic beaches of Southern California, and at the center of it all, the SANTA MONICA PIER.

dialogues.text: It would be a typical day, except for that some PEOPLE ar preparing for a "HEAL THE BAY" rally at the end of the pi VENDORS set up, preparing for the daily grind ahead. BIKERS gather around a bad-ass HELLCAT G2 CONFEDERATE MOTORCYCLE and admire its cutting-edge design. HOT CHICKS in bikinis try on sunglasses at a stand. FISHERMEN crack beers while awaiting the next bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen displays a car-race arcade game. A computer generated hot-rod passes other racers at breakneck speed. Playing the sit-down game, DAYTONA USA, is: RYAN ACKERMAN, early twenties, looks like he grew up on t beach without so much as a pot to piss in. His lethal reflexes and bold recklessness, however, have made him a Master of the game. Ryan's score approaches the HIGH SCORE at the top of the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You recording this?

dialogues.text: Yeah, sure... CHAD, his best bud, aims a BLUE TOOTH VIDEOSTREAMING CELLPHONE at some CUTE GIRLS instead. We can see their fa on the tiny SCREEN of the cellphone. Ryan's car gets caught behind a blue speedster, then pass on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move, bitch. He gets an EXTENDED PLAY and the screen flashes "NEW RECO Nearby, a KID watching the game nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. The HIGH SCORE starts rising to match Ryan's score.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Chad, I gotta put my mouth on that. Holding a cup of soda between his teeth, Chad pulls the cellphone out of his pants and hits "SEND".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through cup-holding teeth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet. It's going to my email right now. S9me soda inadvertently SPILLS onto the cellphone and Cha wipes it dry on his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it dude, I gotta return that thing in seven days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They aren't giving you shit yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: As seen looking over the rail of the pier.      The tide but it's still a forty foot drop. RYAN stares over the railing like a death row inmate contemplating his last meal. CHAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go already. No one's looking. His left hand holds his WALLET.

dialogues.speaker: CHAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: wallet) Need me to hold that? Ryan sticks it in the pocket of his surfer shorts -- he z a zipper, tucks a Velcro flap. Pats his pocket proudly. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waterproof. But as soon as Ryan covertly CLIMBS ONTO THE RAIL, his le leg starts trembling like crazy. RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is stupid. I could get killed. Pick another dare. Chad lowers the phone, irritated. CHAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ass. Not after you made me march in the Gay Pride Parade wearing a thong. RYAN

dialogues.text: Screw it then. In one... Two... Two and a half-- CHAD

dialogues.speaker: CHAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (speaking like HAL 900) Transmitting pussy file now. CHLOE, early 20s, a head turner, confident, funny; she ca pull you in like a tractor beam. She and some CUTE FRIEND carry heavy cardboard boxes toward a table set up for the "Heal The Bay" rally. Ryan walks over like he owns the place. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got any more? I'm here to help. CHLOE

dialogues.text: Thanks, but no, we got 'em all. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in 'em? Chloe opens the box.    Hands him a "Heal The Bay" pamphl RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, wanna help? Ryan tries to ignore his thundering heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah.     I'm all about "Heal the Bay. " His eyes ricochet off the pamphlet in his hand. RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me an Chad do the monthly cleanup thing, of course... An awesome wing-man, Chad appears over Chloe's shoulder, pretending to read a pamphlet, but really holding it up s Ryan can see it. Piece of cake, now. RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've collected water samples with the Stream Team, raised money on the Promenade... I'm surprised I haven't seen you. He offers his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan. She takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chloe. The handshake lingers a second longer than necessary, and they both smile at each other. Chad splits. CHLOE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell if you're full of it. Ryan stops posturing, gets real. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever go up to Santa Barbara? My dad used to take me there all RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the time. Their pier is amazing, clear water, huge crabs everywhere, oysters right there on the rocks, starfish... Hard to believe it's the same ocean sometimes. He's managed to win her back. CHLOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you and I can take a break later when Pat Benatar goes on. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.     How much is the bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.    It's been paid up front. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you promise not to go anywhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done. Ryan makes a graceful exit.       Turns back. RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I won't be long.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: (laughing) Bye. Ryan grabs Chad, and as they walk out of earshot: RYAN

dialogues.text: A short time later, Ryan cruises through a Venice neighborhood. Ryan drives an early 70's Ford Bronco; clothes are strewn across the backseat, and a box of "Heal the Bay" T-SHIRTS sits on the shotgun seat. Ryan reaches into the glove box and pulls out a toothbrus He sips warm soda from a bottle and begins brushing. Checking himself out in the mirror, he sniffs his pits, w and grabs the cellphone. RYAN

dialogues.text: (into phone) Dex, wassup? You won't believe the hotties I just met at the pier. Smoking. You wanna meet them? Yeah? Well don't get too excited 'cause I need my money. Ryan stops at a red light. RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Bullshit, you're not going anywhere, (quickly adding) I'm pulling up right now. Some AMBULANCES SPEED BY, SIRENS BLARING.   It's deafenin Ryan lays on the horn.   When the light changes, Ryan pee away angrily. RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: (covering his ear) What? Yeah, you better be. And I need your shower, I'm talkin' code red stankage- The CELLPHONE begins to CRACKLE with STATIC just as Ryan drives under an OVERPASS. Suddenly -- The car ahead of him STOPS in the middle of the street. R notices too late and has to jam on the brakes. The car skids, he SCREAMS... and comes to a stop an inch before hitting the other car's bumper. He lifts the phone receiver to his ear but the call is WA WITH STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: With still no answer, Ryan pulls the phone from his ear -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!    Don't hang up! Ryan puts the phone back to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not much time! I need you to go to the police. My name is Jessica Martin; I've been kidnapped!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not buying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: THE CELLPHONE
dialogues.text: The LCD reads:     CALL WAITING.   ACCEPT?

dialogues.text: A WIDER SHOT so we see Jessica's bound hands. Her bruised face. Whispering frantically into the DEMOLISHED TELEPHON she's JERI-RIGGING back together as she talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, listen to me! The phone I'm on...it's shattered! There's no dialer! I've been clicking wires together for hours trying to get someone, anyone, and you 're the only connection I was able to make! (important beat) If you hang up, I may not get anyone else.

dialogues.speaker: CALL
dialogues.text: SFX: Ryan's call waiting BLIPS again.        He considers everything Jessica has said, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: JESSICA (VO)

dialogues.text: --an you hear me?! RYAN

dialogues.text: Haven't you ever bet on a horse or bought a Lottery ticket? I'm talking one-in-five odds, twenty minutes. Ryan slaps the radio off.

dialogues.text: In EXTREME SLOW-MOTION, chaos unfolds around us like a nightmare -- OFFICERS manhandle a drunk toward the back, a HOOKER scre at us with unholy rage, in the far corner, a JUNKIE spits 20 an OFFICER'S FACE and there's a lethal race for disinfect through invisible soup. dialogues.text: So I start searching the place. I'm about to open a closet door when a kid with a Mac 10 jumps out of the bathroom. He shoots. Misses me and hits one of the E.M.T's. Fires again, but the gun jams and BAM! Blows half his face off. Had enough black tar heroin in the closet to resurface the 405. Mooney tries to join in on the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must've been around '84, when... The Cops turn around, while grabbing their stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Moon, we're late for a briefing. Mooney waves them on, but looks disappointed for not bein able to join in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet in your day you had some stories. Mooney whips his head around to see DETECTIVE JACK TOMLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Tomlin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hardly thrilled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My anniversary. You know, duty calls; pricey dinner and then some crap-ass play. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I sent some college kid down to see you this morning. Had some rap about a kidnapping --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't seen anyone, but I'll ask around. Kidnapping, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was a prank at first, but the kid was so worked up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't you get worked up. (slaps Mooney's chest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the kid comes back, page me, and I'll be sure to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallowing his pride)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay, Jack. Thanks. And as Tomlin walks off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan lead-foots the gas. The speedometer climbs.   Forty. Fifty. Sixty miles an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Johnny, you've got to go back to the cops--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you high?! I just jacked a car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, stop thinking about just yourself! You can explain everything to them later! SUDDENLY -- SFX: RYAN'S PHONE BEGINS BEEPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now? Ryan pulls the phone away from his ear and checks it out.

dialogues.speaker: CELLPHONE FACE PLATE
dialogues.text: The BATTERY INDICATOR is flashing:         LOW BATT.   LO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great!   Now the battery's dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have a charger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in my car!      Hold on. SFX:   BEEP-BEEP!    The battery indicator has lost anoth Ryan fumbles around in the armrest. Finds nothing. Opens the glovebox and -- a snub-nosed .38 SPECIAL tumbles out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? Did you find one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at the gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly... SFX:   BEEP-BEEP!!     Jessica starts growing afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny, don't lose me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what the hell do you expect me to do?! Just then, Ryan rounds a corner -- and sees traffic GRIDL to a halt ahead. He tries to maneuver around it, but is almost immediately boxed in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Jessica! The phone starts a STEADY BEEPING now, dying imminent. An traffic isn't going anywhere. Ryan looks around desperate Nothing. No emergency lane. No shoulder. Just a long drop down a HILL to a strip mall below-- STRIP MALL?! Ryan scans it and does a double-take on one the store's signs: "VERIZON WIRELESS". Traffic inches forward. Now he sees an OFF-RAMP a quarter mile ahead -- but at this rate, it'll take forever to mak there.

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Ryan's got to do something.      Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that money you promised me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm giving myself a raise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Ryan CRANKS the steering wheel hard right HITS THE GAS!   Despite other drivers' protests, the litt Rent-a-Cop vehicle blasts across the gridlock, TEARS thro the rusty GUARD RAIL and -- VROOOOM! -- flies off the sid the hill! Ryan lets out a frightened yell as he SAILS through the c blue sky.

dialogues.speaker: HOOOOLLYYY SHIIII--
dialogues.text: THUMP! The Rent-a-Cop car touches down on a steep downslo Ryan struggles to control the bucking automobile, miraculously avoiding the minefield of ROCKS and TREE STU He needs both hands for the job and holds the phone by it antenna in his teeth. There's so much noise, the only thing Jessica could possi hear is a CACOPHONY OF NOISE and Ryan HYPERVENTILATING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with phone in teeth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: mmmrrmph mrm mrmph! Ryan is bounced around like a corn kernel in a popper unt the car hits a jutting rock and -- WHOOOOM! -- goes up on wheels. It looks like it's going to roll but gravity brin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47 it back down -- SLAMM! -- so hard that the phone goes fly across the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Ryan scrabbles for the phone -- but gives it up when he bounces over a rise and sees A BILLBOARD DEAD AHEAD!

dialogues.speaker: WHOAAAAAA
dialogues.text: Ryan whips the wheel and navigates the little car between billboard's concrete posts, but -- WHAM! -- obliterates t rent-a-cop's BUBBLE LIGHTS on the billboard's lower edge. Somehow, Ryan muscles the bucking econocar safely down th rest of the hill and into the strip mall parking lot, whe it SKIDS OUT. RYAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing phone) Jessica?! Can you hear me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here! Ryan hops out and races inside--

dialogues.speaker: THE VERIZON WIRELESS STORE
dialogues.text: And of course, they're having a sale and the place is pac Every SALESPERSON is beyond busy in the feeding frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Panicking, Ryan pushes his way to the front of the counte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what do you think you're doing? There's a line! -- to the OVERLY-PERKY SALESMAN helping someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..and if you get the new Nokia 9200, you can switch out faceplates to match your mood! And we have a special today on tiger stripes... Are you feeling fierce? The salesman makes a playful paw swipe with his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, how fun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir, I'm with a customer now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates a number dispenser) But if you take a number, someone will be with you shortly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan glances at the dispenser. A BIG YELLOW SMILEY FACE w tickets ejected from the mouth. The next ticket it offers "#97"...and the Now-Serving Display on the wall reads "#7

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Just then, a BUSY SALESWOMAN walks by.     Ryan grabs her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey!      I've got an emergency here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I'm on break--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, will you listen to me?! I've got a life and death call on this phone and my battery's dying! Do you have a charger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. (walks away) Take a number and one of the sales associates will grab you one when your turn comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bu t-- !

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Ryan breaks out in a cold sweat. Can't catch his breath. a SALESWOMAN rushes by, Ryan reaches for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room starts spinning around him. It's clear no one's going to help him. Like the clap of doom, the NOW-SERVING DISPLAY on the wall flips happily to "#72"

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Frantic, Ryan glances at the phone. And just as the last BATTERY BAR on the power indicator FLICKERS and DISAPPEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, screw this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Ryan pulls the rent-a-cop's big .38 SPECIAL from his pocket and BLOWS THE SMILEY FACE DISPENSER TO DUST!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 Instantly, people hit the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh look! Now serving thirty eight special! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mooney exits the mayhem of the s   tation and walks to a CAR. Gets in. As he pulls his      seatbelt on, something CRINKLES in his breast pocket.     He pulls it out -- the OF PAPER where the scribbled the    words "JESSICA MARTIN "BRENTWOOD" when Ryan handed him    the phone. Mooney crumples the paper and is about to throw it away.. stops himself. He stares at the words, then unable to let go, punches keys on the MOBILE DATA TERMINAL. A name and address appear on the screen: JESSICA KATE MARTIN.   327 ELMWOOD ESTATES, BRENTWOOD. Mooney stares at the name. Then, after a moment, he sighs and pulls a LA LAKERS cellphone from his coat. Dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, honey. Yeah, I'm gonna be a few minutes late... And as Mooney closes the door and starts up the engine--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN PAST PHOTOGRAPHS of Jessica's family over to- AN ANSWERING MACHINE RINGS... ANSWERS.    We hear Jessica outgoing message, then a BEEP and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over machine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica? Damn, where are you? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called earlier and... Jess, I'm in serious trouble. I can't explain right now, but we're all in danger. Please, just grab Ricky and meet me in left field. PAN UP to an ATTRACTIVE WOMAN listening to the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as the phone literally dies -- Ryan rips a new CHARG from its packaging, slaps it into the phone and voila, it begins CHARGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew!   That was so no bueno!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found a charger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among other things... Ryan glances at piles of phone gear he's appropriated fro Verizon. EARBUD MIKES. MANUALS. RECEPTION BOOSTERS.

dialogues.speaker: CALL
dialogues.text: Ryan fiddles with the now war-torn phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for doing all this, Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, look, about that... (awkward beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My-name isn't really Johnny Fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, it sounded like a porn star name. (then softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I know. You don't have to tell me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Ryan. Ryan Ackerman. I'm a bar-back. I'm twenty-two, and just a little freaked out right now. Jessica is moved with emotion by his honesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ryan. But before they can say any more, suddenly--

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Jessica JUMPS with a start. Tries to push the PHONE GUTS behind a beam with her foot as Greer enters -- but fails. The receiver sits in front of the beam, EXPOSED! Greer crosses the room and sits on a box next to Jessica. stares at her for long, uncomfortable moments. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to die here? Jessica drains white -- Does he see the phone?!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Slams on the brakes and skids up to the curb.      Covers mouthpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ATTIC
dialogues.text: Greer's question still hangs in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N-no... Jessica scoots away, trying to draw Greer's eyes in anoth direction from the phone that lies OUT IN THE OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I am going to, aren't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up to you. Your husband left a message asking you to meet him in left field. Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   I don't understand--? Greer winds up and BAM! Hits Jessica in the stomach, knoc the wind out of her and causing her to fall to the ground

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --A base ball field !? Wh ich o ne does he mean?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choking out the words)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I don't know what you want me to say. I swear--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!!! Which field?! He wouldn't leave a message that didn't make sense to you! Greer tightens his fist and is about to hit Jessica again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! The bleachers behind left field at Dodger Stadium! That's where we first met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 54 Greer stares at Jessica for a long uncomfortable moment, searching her soul. She's lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! Believe me. That has to be where he means. I swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he stands, looking away for just a moment -- but lon enough for Jessica to NUDGE the phone back behind the bea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working in my profession as long as I have, you begin to recognize the truth when you hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica, trembling, hangs on Greer's every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back) Go to the window, Jessica. There's something I want you to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relieved at hiding the phone, Jessica gets up and moves t the attic window -- and GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: THE YARD BELOW
dialogues.text: Down in the yard below, Jessica's eleven-year-old son Ric stands uncomfortably in the middle of a basketball half-c as one of the kidnappers (a severe-looking ex-con named HODGES) stands nearby, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica's knees nearly buckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hodges looks up and sees Jessica's face in the window. turns and tosses a basketball to Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot hoops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I..   I don't feel like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (threatening) Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervously, Ricky begins to bounce the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica sees her son start shooting the ball -- completel oblivious to Hodges, who flicks open his coat, revealing SILENCED PISTOL tucked into his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have three seconds to tell me where he really is or you're going to a funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan's listening.     Helpless.   There's nothing he can

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus!    Oh Jesus!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica drains ghost-white. On the verge of passing out. Down below, Ricky shoots baskets, unaware of Hodges closi his hand around his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One.. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please!     Please, believe me! Ricky plays innocently -- while Hodges now COCKS his pist

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two. Frantic, Jessica locks eyes with Hodges, silently pleadin for him not to do this. Hodges stares back with glacial i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing uncontrollably)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, he's just a child!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan is more frenzied than Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, listen to her!     She doesn't know!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky backs up to retrieve a high rebound. Jessica watche in horror as Hodges begins to slowly DRAW HIS GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...no.'    I swear that's all I know! Greer gives a sigh of disbelief --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thre--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OKAY! ... okay... (breaking down) LAX Airport! There's a bar called Left Field. That's where we met. We were in college on our way to Mardi-gras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan's completely floored by Jessica's admission.     She all along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please God, I swear that's the truth. Don't kill my son!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people don't get past two. Greer signals, and: .-В·>    EXT. SAFEHOUSE - DAY Hodges tucks his gun away...just as Ricky turns around. kid startles that Hodges was so close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, kid.     Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica watches as her son is led away to the GUEST HOUSE across the yard. Once he's inside and out of view, Jessic collapses in a heap on the floor. Greer is about to exit the attic -- when Jessica speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't get away with this. When I didn't show up at the hospital, someone must have called the police--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are the last people on earth I'm worried about... Greer pulls a Police Scanner out of his jacket and shows to Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: listening to the call with every fiber of his being.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get one hit on the scanner about you, we'll be picking out family plots, comprende?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a HUMMER, with the BASS THUMPING at ear-shatter decibels, pulls alongside Ryan's car. DMX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "SOME NIGGAS THAT YOU DON'T WANNA TRY, (MY NIGGAS) SOME NIGGAS JUST ABOUT DO OR DIE (MY NIGGAS) ..."

dialogues.speaker: THE ATTIC
dialogues.text: Jessica hears it first. The pumping cacophony coming from the phone behind the beam. It's subtle at first, but grow increasingly louder. She closes her eyes, praying Greer won't hear it-- But Greer does hear it. On the verge of leaving the room, Greer stops. Cocks an ear. Instantly, Jessica tries to cover it with her own voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you honestly expect me to believe we're going to walk away from this alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Greer isn't listening to her. He strides back into th room, listening to the noise under her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jessica) Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oblivious of Jessica desperately trying to clue him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I SHUT UP? You threaten to kill my child and you expect me to act like a MUTE?! If this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, it hits Ryan like a punch to the face.     And scrambles, trying to cover the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!   Where's mute?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...your child, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 BLAMM!! -- Greer shoots a hole in the wall next to Jessic head. Afraid, she shuts her mouth... and prays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan finds the MUTE BUTTON.      Presses it and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer listens intently... and HEARS NOTHING but silence i the still attic. Soon, he turns to leave. Only when he's gone does Jessica's heart start beating again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HUMMER finally pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "(MY NIGGAS) IF THEY COULD (MY NIGGAS) they would (my niggas)...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the thumping bass subsides, Ryan sighs with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deason and Ellis wait for Greer, who enters, pulling off mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Left Field sports bar at LAX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you positive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer ignores him.    Then turns to Deason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Hodges we move in ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deason nods and moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica lies on the floor, sobbing into her knees. Soft as an insect's buzz, we can hear Ryan calling to her the broken phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica...? Answer me, goddamn it I Soon, his voice pierces the suffocating gloom around her she crawls desperately over to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan's freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?!     I thought they--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?    Why'd you lie to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (welling up with tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I like gambling with my son's life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell. You seem pretty good at it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see, Ryan? Once they get Craig, we're all gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't know that for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be realistic. Does letting us live benefit them in any way? No! The only chance he's got is if you can get to the airport and find him before they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, please! There's no time! Just get to the airport--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's suicide. They'll kill me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77 J...      JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't! You're invisible to them! They don't know who you are. They don't know anything about you. Please! You've got to try!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady, I've jacked two cars, been accused of being a child molester, obliterated a car dealership, and busted three caps in a Verizon store. -- Don't tell me I'm not trying! Jessica tries another tack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I have no right to ask you this Ryan, but you re my family's only chance...and I am asking. Something in the way she says that last sentence, a mixtu of strength and vulnerability, gets through to Ryan. And against his own will, he's swayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gives in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the phone to your husband, but that's gotta be it, okay?! В»               * Ryan, heading toward the airport, floors the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PATROL CAR prowls down a quaint residential block. Come to a stop in the driveway of what we know to be Jessica Martin's house. Mooney gets out. Knocks. The door opens, revealing the ATTRACTIVE YOUNG WOMAN from before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Martin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica Kate Martin? The Woman nods. Mooney is plainly disillusioned by the woman. Maybe his hunch was wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam I help you, Officer...? She scans Mooney's badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mooney. (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, I guess not. Must've been a prank. I m sorry to have b9thered you, Ms. Martin. Have a nice day. The Woman smiles and nods, and Mooney walks off. When he gets to his car, he CRUMPLES the paper with Jessica's nam and address, and shakes his head, chuckling at himself. As Mooney drives off--

dialogues.speaker: THE ATTRACTIVE WOMAN
dialogues.text: walks back into the house and flips open her CELLPHONE. W she finishes dialing, a familiar DEEP MALE VOICE answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Bayback. Remember the Fusco brothers? Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've got an itch that needs scatching.

dialogues.speaker: ECU
dialogues.text: Too close to make out who it is just yet--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the middle of a shit storm, and I need you to put a leash put on an officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Officer Mooney from your division. Know him? Now, we start PULLING BACK, revealing the man's features.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mooney? He's a desk sergeant.      What would you want with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to do a B & E and he came snooping around the house looking for the owner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I was her, of course. Continue PULLING BACK.   We can almost recognize him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he believe you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. He said he thought someone was pulling a prank on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mooney doing an investigation? What's are you really up to? The man swivels around in his chair and we see clearly it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And no bullshit. Right now you're entire department's hot, so if I'm gonna get in the tub, I've got to know how deep it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan drives like madman toward the airport, blowing throu lights. Jessica is frantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you now?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be at the airport in twenty minu --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty minutes! Oh my God, Ryan, you've got to drive faster! Please--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica, this car has a sewing machine for an engine! I can't go any faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.   I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica's voice trails off as she catches a glimp se of herself in an OLD MIRROR standing in the corner.  Bruised Clothes torn. Staring at her own cracked reflect  ion, sh breaks down, but silently this time, locked in he r own personal hell. For Ryan, the silence is deafening. Despite his frantic driving, he feels her pain. And hates being unable to hel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica... ? There's an emotional beat, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think God will forgive me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what I've done...   For giving up Craig... Ryan is moved by the emotion in her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica, they have your kid. You had no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 know. I heard what they were doing to you over there. You held out for as long as you could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grim beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son and I are going to die here, Ryan. They already have us. But maybe I could've saved Craig... The truth of this has a profound effect on Ryan. And just when Jessica is about to lose herself to despair -- Ryan finds a resolve within himself even he didn't know h had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica, listen to me. I promise you, I'm not going to let that happen. I could care less about your money. I'm risking my life cause I know I'm gonna get you and your family out of this. You hear what I'm sayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 There is a moment between them, two people connecting on human level... But the moment is suddenly cut short as a STATICKY VOICE start bleeding into their phone call -- some BRITISH ASSH having his own phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Yeah, the show just bought me a Cadillac XLR convertible. No, you can't ride in it. Not until you do something with that road kill you call hair. And what's with your makeup? Kabuki Theatre is not in style --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica? Are you still there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey?!    This is a private call! Jessica's voice starts fading as the CROSSTALK gets worse JESSICA (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (washed in static) I'm..ere, but y...reaking up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off my line! Are you there? Mom? I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen dude, this woman's in serious --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --That's not my problem, lady. Lady?! Suddenly, STATIC starts drowning out Ryan's side o the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling over the static)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica, don't hang up! You hear me?! Whatever happens --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look woman, tell your kidnapping story to someone who gives a shit. Ryan can't hear Jessica's side of the conversation; only British Asshole's, which comes in loud and clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica?!     Jessica?! As Ryan goes mental, a CAR PASSES HIM on the opp9site sid the road -- a new Cadillac XLR convertible! Inside is an appropriately asshole-ish looking guy. He could only be t British Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha. Ryan pulls a HARROWING 180 DEGREE TURN, barely missing an oncoming car by inches. He RACES up to the Cadillac, which has a VANITY PLATE tha reads, "IDOL MKR." Ryan looks through the window at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver, who in a typical LA celebrity sighting, turns to be none other than SIMON COWELL, host of American Idol Simon continues his spittle-spraying rant -- at no one. appears he's using the car's SPEAKERPHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan eyes Simon's mouth while hearing: SIMON COWELL (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over Ryan's cellphone) Murdered your housekeeper? Don't bullshit me; I work in the Industry that invented it you stupid COW! Ryan sees Simon Cowell MOUTH THE WORDS "STUPID COW" in sy with the conversation. BINGO! Ryan floors the Rent-a-cop car ahead of the Cadillac and PULLS A 90 DEGREE turn at an intersection; cutting Cowell off! SCREEEECH! Cowell, trying to avoid a collision, SLAMS on brakes, causing the Cadillac to SKID twenty feet. Ryan jumps out of the rent-a-cop car he's left in the mid or the intersection and runs over to the Cadillac, bangin the window with the .38 Special. Cowell practically jumps out of his skin at the sight of gun and the kid with the crazy look in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that phone... or I shoot your car! Cowell is prepared to comply -- but suddenly behind them-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83 -- Ryan notices a 10-TON SEMI heading straight for the Re cop car too late. The DRIVER SLAMS his brakes, but --

dialogues.speaker: THE RENT-A-COP CAR
dialogues.text: EXPLODES into tiny pieces of junk as the semi PLOUGHS THR IT! Flaming debris rains down around Ryan, and he covers mouth, unable to believe his shitty luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't that a bitch! Ryan turns back to Simon Cowell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the car! Now! Cowell all but dives out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your phone?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on speaker! Ryan turns to the car.    Calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan?!    I'm here! Her voice says she can't believe her ears. Relieved, Ryan jumps in the Cadillac XLR and tosses his p on the passenger seat, next to a LAPTOP computer. Guns th engine and STOMPS the gas. As he passes the ruins of his rent-a-cop car, he slows ju enough to open the Cadillac's door and snatch up his bag Verizon goodies laying on the pavement -- then peels away Practically frothing at the mouth, Simon Cowell chases af on foot, cursing as his beautiful new Cadillac disappears the distance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your career's over!    YOU HEAR ME?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jessica's voice RESOUNDS around him, he notices the phone's controlled through the radio. He turns it up. JESSICA (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still shaken) I thought they... I thought I was--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're okay. It's okay now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Along with the million other cars, FIND the Cadillac threading its way up to the main terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan tries to avoid eye contact with the TRAFFIC COP assisting the flow of cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here... Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREEEECH! Ryan steps on the brakes, seeing something ahe WHIP PAN AROUND to see what Ryan's staring at. Just ahead JESSICA'S ESCALADE is pulling up to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your car's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan pulls along side the red curb and watches as four to looking men exit the vehicle. We recognize them as Greer, Deason, Ellis and Hodges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, Ryan! Just find Craig!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan hops out -- but stops when the car CALLS OUT TO HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Ryan! What about me--?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan searches the car and finds the HANDSET in the armres As he grabs it and races after Greer into the airport, a Traffic Cop comes up to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEY, YOU CAN'T PARK HERE!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's too late.   Ryan's already gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer and his men stride through the airport like sharks honing in on bleeding prey. Soon, the Kidnappers break up into two groups: Greer and Ellis heading for the DEPARTURE GATES; Deason and Hodges the other way towards the INFORMATION KIOSK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan heads toward the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer, who waits in the LINE OF PASSENGERS waiting to pas through airport's METAL DETECTORS. This is Ryan's chance. He cuts through the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops. Excuse me. Pardon me. My grandmother needs her walker... Soon, he makes his way to the front, right behind Greer a BUMPS into him. As he does, NOTICE -- ECU of Ryan slyly slipping the rent-a-cop's tiny .38 Spec into Greer's heavy motorcycle jacket. Greer turns, glaring -- But no one's there. Greer looks around, and there's a heart-stopping moment t we're afraid he's going to notice Ryan, who now stands innocently the next line over-- --but Greer's eyes pass right over him as he scans the cr Ryan breathes a sigh of relief as Greer finally turns awa walk through the metal detector and...

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: ...sets off the alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir. Would you mind emptying your pockets over here? Confused, Greer does. He lays his wallet on the table, th his keys... Then looks baffled as he pulls out -- the GUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Code red!     Code red! The response she gets is stunning. SECURITY GUARDS jump o of the woodwork with guns drawn. ALARMS go off. SECURITY GATES start coming down. Travelers start SCREAMING and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching for something)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, this is a mistake--

dialogues.speaker: HANDS/ HANDS
dialogues.text: As one, the entire security force POUNCES on Greer and El TACKLING them to the ground and IMMOBILIZING their limbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 And while that chaos is going on, Ryan slowly backs throu to the metal detector...and starts running for Left Field

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREER AND ELLIS are crushed under the dogpile of security Behind them, a door slams open and a formation of NATIONA GUARDSMEN race on-scene, showing just how seriously secur is taken in the wake of Sept. 11th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan jogs down the concourse when--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention travelers. Due to a security problem, all persons are required to clear the terminal and return immediately to the security checkpoint at the entrance to Concourse B... At once, everyone begins filing out of the terminal. Ryan looks like a salmon swimming upstream, the only figure mo against the tide of people rushing to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Left Field" is in Terminal C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me! They're clearing the terminal. Before your husband passes me, what does he look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's thirty-eight. Six feet.     Trim build. Thinning hair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scanning the passengers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not enough! What's he wearing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! We have completely different schedules. I was fast aslee p-- (thinking it through)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A suit... He wears glasses, thick rims, like Buddy Holly or-- Bingo! The Buddy Holly glasses is what did it. Ryan sees man in the distance hurrying in his direction -- CRAIG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 91 And just as Ryan bee-lines it towards Craig-- VOICE (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir-- Ryan turns and finds a NATIONAL GUARDSMAN right behind hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't be here now. You have to leave the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as Ryan is marched away he sees--

dialogues.speaker: GREER AND ELLIS
dialogues.text: Knees in their necks.    Hands covering their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- if you'd just listen to me! I can explain! Someone reach into my coat pocket! Goddamn it, reach into my pocket!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG GUARDSMAN does -- and in a big reveal, we see tha WITHDRAWS A BADGE. A Los Angeles policeman's badge... Ryan's jaw drops.      He can't believe it -- they're cop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this one's on the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, Jessica, these guys are cops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guardsman's SUPERIOR OFFICER examines it.      Is it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run it. (the Guardsman runs off; turns back to Greer) Is that your gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates) --yes. Yes. It's my piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're supposed to declare it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. We just got focused on a rabbit we're here to nab. Just then, the Young Guardsman returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's clean. Badge matches his I.D. SUPERIOR OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grumbles) Unhook 'em. Stand down security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan looks relieved when the airport's alarms SHUT OFF._ P.A. system cheerily thanks everyone for their cooperatio and, all around, security gates begin to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing; to Guard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, can I go now? Can I go?! The Guard nods, and Ryan takes off like a shot, racing ba towards the bar. Ryan spots Craig Martin outside the Left Field sports bar Ryan grabs him by the elbow and starts hustling him throu the concourse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what the hell?!    Get your hands off m--!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and keep walking. If they see us they'll kill us both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife sent me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did?   But how--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you hurry your ass?! You need to hide. They're here, and they're looking for you. They already have your family. Craig looks at him, growing terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93 Ryan pulls Craig into the MENS RESTROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. She'll explain it to you. (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Jessica, I'm handing you over now.

dialogues.speaker: CALL
dialogues.text: Relief can be traced on Jessica's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (welling up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, you've done so much.     I don't know how to repay you... An awkward, emotional pause falls between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about the cash. Just get you and y9ur son home safely and we'll call it even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.   I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you will. RYAN hands the cellphone over to Craig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna be outside this door. Don't come out unless I get you. Got it? CRAIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Okay. Ryan walks out the restroom door as Craig puts the phone his ear. He sighs with relief -- it's finally over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREER and ELLIS stride toward the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice move. What the hell you bring a gun for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sounding nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep your eyes open! Something weird is going on. Greer stares daggers at everyone he passes. Ellis Io9ks around before glancing down at a PHOTO COPY o California driver's license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to act inconspicuous, Ryan guards the entrance to Men's Room. He's starts to check out a magazine rack at a adjacent concession stand when he hears:

dialogues.speaker: HEY, RYAN
dialogues.text: Ryan turns. RACK FOCUS past Ryan to Craig standing fifty feet back, holding the phone out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't my wife.

dialogues.speaker: ECU ON RYAN'S FACE
dialogues.text: As it sinks in.   Disbelief.    Anger.   Dread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife's name is Patty. I'm not Craig. I'm Paul. Paul Boyd. In utter disbelief, Ryan turns back toward the gate -- an sees Greer, Ellis, Hodges and Deason, cornering another M Tall. Lean. Thinning hair. And wearing Buddy Holly glasses.    The real CRAIG MARTIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer seizes Craig by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make a scene and you'll never see your family again. Now who's here with you? Craig's eyes swell with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, what?... No one!   Nobody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer me! Greer looks around the crowded airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll forget I saw anything, just leave them alone! Whatever.    Greer manhandles Craig toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your family's sake, you better not have done anything stupid. RYAN snatches the phone from the bogus Craig Martin -- an hauls ass through a sea of travelers, trying to catch up

dialogues.speaker: GREER AND ELLIS
dialogues.text: "x who scan the crowd bulling their way through throngs of people, leading Craig Martin between them.

dialogues.speaker: BUT RYAN
dialogues.text: Has more difficulty. Gets STALLED and SWEPT AWAY in the crowd long enough for the kidnappers to make it outside--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To their car. Craig is forced into the ESCALADE between Greer and Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You goddamn animals better not have hu rt -- Greer surprises him with a vicious ELBOW to the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animals? Ellis whips a burlap hood over Craig's head and they driv off just as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He said you looked distracted when you left. He wants you to relax, Bob. He said they found that kid you were looking for and that you were right, it was all a prank. Nothing to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls him back down for another kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I gonna do with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna dance with me all night long, until we're too pooped to pop... Well almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giggle.    They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I will, after I shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both share a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lame ass.   Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes herself down the hallway and he follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it pulls off the road onto the driveway of the kidnapp safe house and parks. Craig still wears the hood as Greer exits the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Craig reaches blindly for a door handle, Ellis opens t door and shoves him out onto the driveway. Greer yanks hi up by his collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET UP!    WALK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With guns at his back, Craig is dragged inside the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The darkness is oppressive.       Craig is pushed inside the hood off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, what the hell are you people going to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig? Craig stops dead, hearing the voice. Scans the cobweb-fil room, seeing nothing -- then from the depths of the shado Jessica materializes looking haunted and lifeless as a gh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica? Jessica races for the safety of Craig's arms, but just as she's about to be embraced, Greer steps forward and YANKS Jessica back by her hair. She squeals in pain.

dialogues.speaker: HEY --/ /
dialogues.text: Craig moves to object, but -- OOF! -- Deason sends him gasping to the floor with a sledgehammer fist to the gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't hurt him! Jessica struggles and, with an annoyed shove, Greer sends spilling into Craig. She hugs tightly against him. When Craig gets his wind back, he comes to his knees and manages to croak out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky...? Jessica nods gravely. He's here, too. Craig looks at his wife's face, bruised and hurt, and tears rise in his eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, Jess... What have they done to you? But Jessica won't let this moment be about pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are they, Craig? Craig doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them, Craig. Tell them they have the wrong family. Tell them they've made a mistake-- But something in his eyes disagrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!      What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 104 .u          CRAIG This isn't a mistake, Jess. And that's all it takes for Jessica's world to shatter. GREEK emerges from the shadows, startling them, and backh Craig's jaw with the butt of his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the disc now? Blood trickles from the corner of Craig's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to promise. If I give it to you... you'll let my family go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what, you tell me where it is-- (turns his gun on Jessica)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and I won't blow her brains all over you right now. Greer traces the barrel of the gun down Jessica's cheek. Craig looks utterly helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your call Craig. It's an eighty-five ''cent bullet to me.
Greer lowers the gun to her neckline( pulls her shirt lower... She pleads "no" at Craig with her eyes, but he finally breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Enough, you win.      But if anything-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (training gun on Craig)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just shut up and talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan rides back into the city in a cab. He listens some more, then covers the phone's mouthpiece taps the CABBIE on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dropped it down the mail chute at work. It's gotta be in the mailroom. JESSICA (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (for Ryan's benefit, weakly) You hid it downtown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change of plans.      I need to get to downtown fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greer pulls Craig to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up.     We're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will I know she's okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shoving him) Move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he gets near the door, Jessica is overcome with emot and races to her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!   WAIT!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brushes past Hodges and hugs on tight to her husband, tears flowing from her eyes. v Hodges goes to pull them apart, but Greer stops him. knows this is going to be their last time together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig squeezes the good years of their marriage into a strong, loving embrace. Jessica hugs him closer. Leans in his ear to seemingly whisper her love in return -- but wh she actually whispers takes Craig by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly; sotto voce) Pretend I'm telling you that I love you. There's an open phone line in here. You'll have help at the office, but if you give these men what they want, we're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica kisses her husband on the lips and withdraws, lea Craig with an utterly confused expression on his face. Bu before his look can betray him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Greer and Hodges move forward, ushering Craig out of th room. When the door locks behind them, Jessica once again rushes to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan?! They're going to Fegan Securities, 4th and Figuroa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, in the cab, weaves through cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm already on my-- Suddenly, the cab rounds a bend -- and grinds to a halt f backed up traffic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gotta be kidding me! (to cabbie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you back it up? The cabbie tries, but is hopelessly locked in by cars pul up behind him. Shrugs. About a hundred yards up the road, Ryan sees the 4th Street/Figuroa Exit. He's so close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, screw this! Ryan throws some bills at the driver, hops out the passen side and starts RUNNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short time later, Ryan( drenched in sweat, sees Craig's office building in the distance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With an all cement exterior (and few windows), it's a cellphone user's nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ryan huffs and puffs toward the building, he sees a BI MESSENGER bullshitting with a HOT DOG VENDOR. Fragments fal through the cracks in the pier, to the ocean below. Ryan, pale as ghost, knows he's seconds from meeting his maker.

dialogues.text: This is about to be the most enjoyable part of an extremely shitty day. And just as he's about to pull the trigger -- BLAM!! Jessica fires a WARNING SHOT. Greer( startled, spi around to see Jessica pointing Hodges' gun in his face.

dialogues.text: I can't believe I almost lost everything that means... I don't know how I can ever thank you.
